Description: Rim sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery open vessel, possibly a pskyter; interior glazed black with added red band at mouth, reserved below; exterior: top of rim reserved with red around outside edge; painted decoration consisting of ivy on vertical face; neck black with red band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0281) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
